title: Bicarbonate Deficit
description: Calculates total body bicarbonate deficit for assessment of metabolic acidosis severity and bicarbonate replacement therapy planning.

result.name: bicarbonate_deficit
result.description: Total body bicarbonate deficit in milliequivalents

interpretation.description: Bicarbonate deficit calculation for metabolic acidosis management
clinical_guidance: This is an estimate of total body bicarbonate deficit
Bicarbonate supplementation should be considered in severe metabolic acidosis
Often bicarbonate levels improve when underlying condition is treated
Consider gradual correction to avoid complications

references: Kurtz I. Acid-Base Case Studies. 2nd Ed. Trafford Publishing (2004); 68:150.
Forsythe SM, Schmidt GA. Sodium bicarbonate for the treatment of lactic acidosis. Chest. 2000;117(1):260.
Kollef MH, et al. The Washington Manual of Critical Care. Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2007; p185:583.
Sabatini S, Kurtzman NA. Bicarbonate Therapy in Severe Metabolic Acidosis. JASN. 2009;20(4):692-695.
formula: Bicarbonate Deficit = 0.4 × Weight (kg) × (Target HCO3 - Current HCO3)
notes: Formula uses distribution volume coefficient of 0.4 for bicarbonate
Used primarily for severe metabolic acidosis (HCO3 < 15 mEq/L)
Consider underlying etiology before bicarbonate supplementation
Avoid overly rapid correction to prevent complications
Monitor arterial blood gas and electrolytes during treatment
